etymology.description: Combines 入 (rù, 'enter') and 一 (yī, 'one') to convey the idea of gathering or coming together.
etymology.interpretation: This character intuitively represents the act of gathering, suggesting a union from different directions.

examples.chinese: 在集会(在集會)时，大家都亼聚。
examples.pinyin: zài jíhuì shí, dàjiā dōu jī jù.
examples.english: During the gathering, everyone came together.

examples.chinese: 这个部件在合并中很重要(這個部件在合併中很重要)。
examples.pinyin: zhège bùjiàn zài hébìnɡ zhōnɡ hěn zhònɡyào.
examples.english: This component is important in merging.
